elements.title: An Ultra-Precise Clock Shows How to Link the Quantum World With Gravity
elements.contents: Time was found to flow differently between the top and bottom of a single cloud of atoms. Physicists hope that such a system will one day help them combine quantum mechanics and Einstein’s theory of gravity.

elements.title: The Uselessness of Useful Knowledge
elements.contents: Today’s powerful but little-understood artificial intelligence breakthroughs echo past examples of unexpected scientific progress.

elements.title: A Hint of Dark Matter Sends Physicists Looking to the Skies
elements.contents: After a search of neutron stars finds preliminary evidence for hypothetical dark matter particles called axions, astrophysicists are devising new ways to spot them.

elements.title: The Astronomer Who’s About to See the Skies of Other Earths
elements.contents: After the ultra-powerful James Webb Space Telescope launches later this year, Laura Kreidberg will lead two efforts to check the weather on rocky planets orbiting other stars.
